name: Dutch Oven Ground Beef Goulash
author: Phil C
summary: This is a smoky, rich, Dutch oven goulash. The cavatappi pasta captures large amounts of this great paprika sauce. While the red pepper and lemon, added towards the end of cooking, add a little freshness which helps balance the sauce. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and some chives.
directions: Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat
Cook and stir onion in the hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add ground beef, black pepper, and salt; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes
Pour in tomatoes, beef broth, wine, paprika, garlic, Worcestershire, thyme, caraway seeds, rosemary, and bay leaves
Reduce heat to medium and simmer until reduced to a thick, stew-like consistency, about 45 minutes
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook cavatappi in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 9 to 10 minutes
Stir bell pepper and lemon juice into the beef mixture and cook for 10 minutes more
Stir in cooked pasta to coat
